com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.metrics

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.metrics.Graph
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MyDependingPluginsGraph, SoftDependenciesGraph

    public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a custom graph on the website

      Constructs a new default Graph for the plugin.

      Constructs a new Graph with the name specified

      • Graph

        public Graph()
        Constructs a new default Graph for the plugin. The name of this new Graph is "Default".

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the graph's name
        Returns:
        the Graph's name

      • clearPlotters

        public void clearPlotters()
        Removes all currently stored plotters from this graph

      • removePlotter

        public void removePlotter(java.lang.String name)
        Remove a plotter from the graph
        Parameters:
        name - of the plotter to remove from the graph

      • togglePlotter

        public void togglePlotter(java.lang.String name,
                 boolean state)
        Toggles a plotter value on or off. If the state is set to True, the number '1' is mapped to the name. If the state is set to False, the entire plotter entry is removed, resulting in '0' being mapped.
        Parameters:
        name - of the toggled plotter
        state - to set the toggled plotter to

      • addPlotter

        public void addPlotter(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.Object value)
        Add a plotter to the graph, which will be used to plot entries. The Object.toString() method of the value should produce a valid numeric number. It is allowed to dynamically produce values this way, but keep in mind that the method is called from another thread.
        Parameters:
        name - of the plotter
        value - of the plotter

      • getPlotters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getPlotters()
        Gets an unmodifiable mapping of the plotter objects in the graph
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable Map of the plotter objects

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • onUpdate

        protected void onUpdate(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Called right before this Graph is being sent to the server. This is called on the main thread (sync), it is allowed to call Bukkit methods.

      • onReset

        protected void onReset(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Called right after the graph has been updated on the server. This is called on the main thread (sync), it is allowed to call Bukkit methods.
